Column Comment.0: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.1: SPECIFICATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specification measured for apeice of equipment.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AVERAGE VALUE: The average or single value assigned to this specification. If onlyone mesuare is provided, it should be stored here.
Column Comment.6: COST: The cost of the equipment use so far, such as fuel cost, maintenance costetc.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.10: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.12: END DATE: The date that this statistical measurement ended.
Column Comment.13: END TIME: The time that this statistical measurement ended.
Column Comment.14: EQUIPMENT USE STATISTIC TYPE: Use statistics for equipment are widely variedin nature, depending on the type of equipment you are tracking. You may need totrack distance driven, distance drilled, total revolutions, total cost of operations etc.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM DATE: the maximum date, that describes this use statistic, such as thelast date it was used.
Column Comment.17: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum value measured, such as the maximum RPM for apump.
Column Comment.20: MINIMUM DATE: the minimum date that describes this use statistic, such as theearliest date it was used.
Column Comment.21: MINIMUM VALUE: the minimum value measured, such as the minimum RPM for apump.
Column Comment.24: PERCENT CAPACITY: The amount of work or function of the equipment relative toits total possible capacity. This is often calculated at a field site, using manufacturersspecifications and performance metrics.
Column Comment.25: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.26: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.27: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.28: START DATE: The date that this statistical measurement started.
Column Comment.29: START TIME: The time that this statistical measurement started.
Column Comment.30: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.31: USAGE CODE: a descriptive code allowed for a particular kind of usage, such asheavy, light, average etc.
Column Comment.32: USE DESCRIPTION: a text based description of the usage of the equipment.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
